docs.snippet: After signing a one-year, $2.5 million deal with the Tigers, Chamberlain is trying to leave behind the strange saga of his seven seasons as a Yankee....
docs.lead_paragraph: After signing a one-year, $2.5 million deal with the Tigers, Chamberlain is trying to leave behind the strange saga of his seven seasons as a Yankee.
docs.abstract: Pitcher Joba Chamberlain, in spring training with the Detroit Tigers, is seeking new start after seven strange and disappointing seasons with the New York Yankees.

headline.main: Joba Chamberlain’s Motto: No More Weirdness

docs.snippet: Todd Frazier, who now plays third base for the Cincinnati Reds, whom the Yankees will play this season, marvels: “I can say, ‘I know Derek Jeter.’ That’s pretty awesome to say.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: Todd Frazier, who now plays third base for the Cincinnati Reds, whom the Yankees will play this season, marvels: “I can say, ‘I know Derek Jeter.’ That’s pretty awesome to say.”
docs.abstract: Todd Frazier, entering his fourth season as third baseman for the Cincinnati Reds, recalls meeting New York Yankees captain Derek Jeter as a little league player in 1998; Frazier, part of a younger generation who was raised on Jeter, will face him in 2014 season, Yankees captain's last.

headline.main: Jeter Brings Out the Kid in a Future Opponent
